security: Revealing this information could expose the operational needs and collection methods of the G-2 co-opted status subject. Specifically, the request to 'ransack Zurc bookstores' and the mention of specific book titles reveals collection priorities and potentially compromises the subject's cover.
summary: A message from MIDDAUGH to ZURC requesting the purchase and shipment of books on espionage and counter-espionage in English or French to support a G-2 co-opted subject's needs.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret message, dated 11 July 1963, from MIDDAUGH to ZURC, urgently requests the procurement of espionage-related books. The books are needed to support a G-2 co-opted subject who needs them for immediate posting to G-. MIDDAUGH asks ZURC to thoroughly search bookstores for any type of work on espionage or counter-espionage, including historical accounts and studies by communist defectors, in either English or French. The message lists examples of books already sent and requests a phone call to confirm the number of books available before commercially mailing them to MIDDAUGH's private address.
title: Request for Espionage Books
